title: Judge Again Blocks Guard Deployment as Trump Expands His Targets
summary: A federal judge in Oregon accused the administration of circumventing her order, even as the president turned to Texas for troops aimed at Chicago and other cities.

title: Pritzker Says Federal Agents Are Trying to Make Chicago a ‘War Zone’
summary: Gov. JB Pritzker of Illinois said he had ordered state agencies to investigate a raid on a Chicago apartment building where there had been reports of  “nearly naked” children zip-tied by federal officers.

title: Both Parties Are Resigned to Deadlock as Government Shutdown Takes Hold
summary: Republicans, who hold a governing trifecta, have adopted a mostly passive stance while Democrats dig in for a fight, with both feeling they have the political upper hand.

title: Supreme Court Starts Consequential Term, and Illinois Governor Warns of ‘Trump’s Invasion’
summary: Plus, when Silicon Valley comes to the farm.

title: Supreme Court Returns to Face Trump Tests of Presidential Power
summary: As the justices return to the bench Monday, the court will confront a series of cases central to the president’s agenda.

title: President Trump and the Supreme Court
summary: Today, we look ahead at the potential consequences of the Supreme Court term that begins today.

title: We Asked 50 Legal Experts About the Trump Presidency. They’re Very, Very Worried.
summary: Before the election, we surveyed the legal establishment about what a second Trump term could mean for the rule of law. A year later, they’re very, very worried.

title: Trying to Survive Gaza’s War-Torn Present, and Hoping for a Future
summary: Two years of intense warfare in Gaza have left its people with a dismembered and disordered society. The destruction is vast and many Gazans have mental and physical wounds that could scar a generation.

title: Gaza Peace Talks Are Set to Take Place in Egypt
summary: Though significant issues remain to be hashed out between Israel and Hamas, some are saying that after two years of death and destruction, a breakthrough may be near.

title: In a New Memoir, an Israeli Captive Looks Ahead with Hope
summary: Freed after 14 months, Eli Sharabi learned that his family didn’t survive the Oct. 7 attacks. “Hostage” is testimony to his suffering and his hope.

title: French Prime Minister Sébastien Lecornu Resigns
summary: Sébastien Lecornu stepped down less than 24 hours after he had formed his cabinet.

title: Fears of Economic Turmoil Deepen in France as Another Prime Minister Quits
summary: The surprise resignation of Sébastien Lecornu after less than a month in office intensified concerns that France would be unable to tackle its enormous debt pile.

title: We May Know Why Ernest Shackleton’s Endurance Really Sank
summary: The explorer’s journey to Antarctica was likely doomed before it began.

title: Internal Audits Shed Light on Ukraine’s Secret Weapons Spending
summary: The government reviews show the country’s challenge as U.S. support wanes and Kyiv pivots to production from a domestic arms industry with a long history of corruption.

title: Appeal Trial Opens in Gisèle Pelicot Rape Case
summary: One man has appealed his conviction in a case in which a Frenchman drugged his wife and invited scores of men to rape her.

title: What to Know as Gisèle Pelicot Returns to Court for Man’s Appeal
summary: The Frenchwoman who became a feminist icon will confront one of the men convicted after her husband drugged her and invited them to rape her over nearly 10 years.

title: The Pelicot Trial: A Timeline
summary: Dominique Pelicot was convicted of drugging and raping his wife, Gisèle Pelicot, and of inviting dozens of men to rape her. Here is how the events unfolded.

title: Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine Is Awarded for Work on Immune Systems
summary: Mary E. Brunkow, Fred Ramsdell and Shimon Sakaguchi were awarded the prize for research showing how the body regulates its immune responses.

title: Beyond the Nobel Prizes Is a World of Scientific Awards
summary: Nobels are awarded in only three scientific categories, but other awards honor researchers across different fields.

title: Ian Roberts, Des Moines Superintendent, Had a Story Too Good to Be True
summary: Ian Roberts rose through the ranks of American education with talent, charm and a riveting back story. He was also hiding a shocking secret.

title: In Ashes of Amazon Fight, Tensions Emerge in Huge Bet on N.Y.C. Housing
summary: Years ago, progressives defeated a plan to build an Amazon warehouse in Queens. Now a new kind of development is gaining their support.

title: Pilots Demand India Ground Boeing 787s to Investigate Use of Emergency System
summary: The ram air turbine, used when electrical power or hydraulic pressure fails, was deployed during an Air India flight that landed safely over the weekend. The same system had been activated during a flight that crashed in June.

title: Is Sports Betting Illegal in Your State? Not if You Call It a ‘Prediction Market.’
summary: Prediction markets like Kalshi, once known for offering wagers on elections, are now in the multibillion-dollar sports betting business and outside the reach of state regulations and taxes.

title: Snowstorm Traps Hundreds of Everest Hikers
summary: The snowfall buried tents and reduced visibility. The local authorities said that they were in contact with the hikers and that rescue efforts were underway.

title: Can Cory Doctorow’s Book ‘Enshittification’ Change the Tech Debate?
summary: Cory Doctorow’s new book looks to offer comfort, and solutions, to the inescapable feeling that digital platforms have gotten worse.

title: Political Violence. Threats to Free Speech. A Disinformation Crisis. We’ve Been Here Before.
summary: To see a way out of our destructive spiral we should look to the innovation of the 1920s.

title: Trump’s Shutdown Glee Could Come Back to Bite Him
summary: Republicans’ exploitation of government’s closure is the tell that they prefer it this way.

title: OpenAI Agrees to Use Computer Chips from AMD
summary: Weeks after a $100 billion agreement to use computer chips from Nvidia, OpenAI has signed a similar deal with a rival chipmaker.

title: Jilly Cooper, British Romance Novelist, Is Dead at 88
summary: A prolific writer and keen observer, she sold millions of copies of her juicy, sometimes racy “Rutshire Chronicles” series.

title: Pakistan Fights Its Fiercest Taliban Insurgency in a Decade
summary: Pakistan uprooted the Taliban with U.S. help in the 2010s. But the insurgency has resurfaced with assistance from the Afghan Taliban.
